Subjects: Adam, creation and fall of; Creed, exposition of; sin, consequences of; penitence
_description: Treatise on sin and salvation through repentance; probably a fragment of a longer work — in couplets

Stafford.First Lines:
GOdde with blisfulle beldisÞat alle þis worlde with
                    wysdome woldisA[n]d alle þat whylum was bot noghtÞou has
                    vnto sere schapyng broght…
Stafford.Last Lines:
… And þat es funden in oure CredeÞat es in Inglisshe
                    þus to redeI trow in myghty god þat wroghtHeuen and erthe
                    and alle of noght…
Stafford.Note:
Two binding fragments, portions of bifolia, top and bottom, by same hand
                    of the fifteenth century.
